result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra J Buckley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cassandra J Buckley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cassandra J Buckley was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 PER MONTH PAYMENT PLAN TO START BY JULY 25, 2014

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra J Buckley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cassandra J Buckley in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to go along with the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes a statement and also asks the court to go along with the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Pay fine and costs = $265.60
DNA Surcharge = $200.00
Ct. 1 to be dismissed.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in July
Plea hearing on June 25, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Cassandra J Buckley in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states his client will waive her right to a preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant as to her waiver.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to a preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
State files Information.  Atty Gumz received the Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant enters Not Guilty plea to all charges.   BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Cassandra J Buckley in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant waives the time limits for the Preliminary Hearing.  

BY THE COURT:  Time limits for Prelim have been waived by the defendant.
Set for Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Cassandra J Buckley
Current: N840 State Rd 22, Dalton, WI 53926 United States  (Effective: 02-10-2014)
Prior: N3560 Ronald Ct, Montello, WI 53949
Preliminary hearing on February 27, 2014 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Cassandra J Buckley in court.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Set for Prelim.  Defendant does not waive time limits.
Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions.
*Appear for booking today
Set for Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 11:15 am.
